bill_title: increase marriage license fees and to allow for a lower fee if the applicants complete premarital counseling.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase marriage license fees and to allow for a lower fee if the applicants complete premarital counseling. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 25-1-10 be amended to read as follows: 25-1-10. Previous to any marriage within this state, a license shall be obtained from the county register of deeds of any county, the fee for which is forty fifty dollars , except as provided in section 2 of this Act . Ten Fifteen dollars of the marriage license fee shall be retained by the county in which the fee is collected and placed in the county general fund. Thirty Thirty-five dollars of the marriage license fee shall be deposited in the county domestic abuse program fund. The license and record of marriage form shall be prescribed and furnished by the Department of Health. Certified copies of the marriage record shall be furnished by the county register of deeds for a fee of seven dollars which shall be retained by the county in which the fee is collected and placed in the county general fund. Section 2. That chapter 25-10 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If the applicants for a marriage license produce written evidence, signed by a premarital education provider, qualified in accordance with section 3 of this Act, of the applicants' completion of premarital education, the applicants may obtain a marriage license for a fee of ten dollars, one-half of which shall be retained by the county in which the fee is collected and placed in the county general fund. The remaining one-half of the marriage license fee shall be deposited in the county domestic abuse program fund. Section 3. That chapter 25-10 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The premarital education described in section 2 of this Act shall consist of at least four hours of instruction to prepare the applicants for marriage, including communication skills, financial management, conflict resolution, parenting skills, and marriage resources. The premarital education shall be provided by an official representative of a religious institution, any member of the clergy authorized to perform marriages, any agent designated by a member of the clergy authorized to perform marriages, a licensed behavioral health professional, a psychologist licensed pursuant chapter 36-27A, a marriage and family therapist licensed pursuant to chapter 36-33, a social worker certified or licensed pursuant chapter 36-26, or a counselor licensed or certified pursuant chapter 36-32. A provider of premarital education shall provide proof of the provider's qualifications to the county register of deeds for the county in which the provider intends to provide premarital education. Section 4. That chapter 25-10 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The county register of deeds shall advise each applicant for a marriage license of this Act before providing the applicant with a marriage license application.

BILL HISTORY 1/24/00 First read in House and referred to committee assignment waived. H.J. 196 1/25/00 Referred to State Affairs. 2/4/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/4/00 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 11, NAYS 1. H.J. 428

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase marriage license fees and to allow for a lower fee if the applicants complete premarital counseling. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 25-1-10 be amended to read as follows: 25-1-10. Previous to any marriage within this state, a license shall be obtained from the county register of deeds of any county, the fee for which is forty seventy dollars , except as provided in section 2 of this Act . Ten Fifteen dollars of the marriage license fee shall be retained by the county in which the fee is collected and placed in the county general fund. Thirty Fifty-five dollars of the marriage license fee shall be deposited in the county domestic abuse program fund. The license and record of marriage form shall be prescribed and furnished by the Department of Health. Certified copies of the marriage record shall be furnished by the county register of deeds for a fee of seven ten dollars which shall be retained by the county in which the fee is collected and placed in the county general fund. Section 2. That chapter 25-10 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If the applicants for a marriage license produce written evidence, signed by a premarital education provider, qualified in accordance with section 3 of this Act, of the applicants' completion of premarital education, the applicants may obtain a marriage license for a fee of forty dollars, ten dollars of which shall be retained by the county in which the fee is collected and placed in the county general fund. The remaining thirty dollars of the marriage license fee shall be deposited in the county domestic abuse program fund. Section 3. That chapter 25-10 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The premarital education described in section 2 of this Act shall consist of at least four hours of instruction to prepare the applicants for marriage, including communication skills, financial management, conflict resolution, parenting skills, and marriage resources. The premarital education shall be provided by an official representative of a religious institution, any member of the clergy authorized to perform marriages, any agent designated by a member of the clergy authorized to perform marriages, a licensed behavioral health professional, a psychologist licensed pursuant chapter 36-27A, a marriage and family therapist licensed pursuant to chapter 36-33, a social worker certified or licensed pursuant chapter 36-26, or a counselor licensed or certified pursuant chapter 36-32. A provider of premarital education shall file with the county register of deeds for the county in which the provider intends to provide premarital education and proof of the provider's qualifications. The provider shall pay a filing registration fee of ten dollars. The filing is valid for six years and the biennial renewal fee is ten dollars. Section 4. That chapter 25-10 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The county register of deeds shall advise each applicant for a marriage license of this Act before providing the applicant with a marriage license application. BILL HISTORY 1/24/00 First read in House and referred to committee assignment waived. H.J. 196 1/25/00 Referred to State Affairs. 2/4/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/4/00 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 11, NAYS 1. H.J. 428 2/8/00 House of Representatives Deferred to another day. H.J. 509 2/9/00 Motion to Amend, Passed. H.J. 541 2/9/00 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 50, NAYS 19. H.J. 541
